original: Netti
analyzed: na itti
translated: The Guide

original: Paṭiniddesavāra🔽Vibhaṅga 9
analyzed: paṭiniddesa vāra  vibhaṅga
translated: The Reversal Section🔽The Analysis

original: Parivattanahāravibhaṅga
analyzed: parivattana hāra vibhaṅga
translated: The Analysis of the Reversal Mode

original: Tattha katamo parivattano hāro?
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ parivattanaḥ hāro
translated: Herein, what is the Reversal Mode?

original: “Kusalākusale dhamme”ti.
analyzed: kusala akusale dhamme iti
translated: “In regard to wholesome and unwholesome things”:

original: Sammādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā bhavati.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhissa purisa puggalassa micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā bhavati
translated: In a person with right view, wrong view is reversed.

original: Ye cassa micchādiṭṭhipaccayā uppajjeyyuṁ aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā, te cassa nijjiṇṇā honti.
analyzed: ye cassa micchādiṭṭhi paccayāḥ uppajjeyyum aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ te cassa nijjiṇṇāḥ honti
translated: And the many evil unwholesome things that originate with wrong view as condition are also reversed.

original: Sammādiṭṭhipaccayā cassa aneke kusalā dhammā sambhavanti, te cassa bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi paccayā cassa aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti te cassa bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti
translated: And the many wholesome things that originate with right view as condition come to fulfilment by development.

original: Sammāsaṅkappassa purisapuggalassa micchāsaṅkappo nijjiṇṇo bhavati.
analyzed: sammā saṅkappassa purisa puggalassa micchā saṅkappaḥ nijjiṇṇaḥ bhavati
translated: In a person with right intention, wrong intention is reversed.

original: Ye cassa micchāsaṅkappapaccayā uppajjeyyuṁ aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā, te cassa nijjiṇṇā honti.🔽Sammāsaṅkappapaccayā cassa aneke kusalā dhammā sambhavanti.
analyzed: ye cassa micchāsaṅkappa paccayāḥ uppajjeyyum aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ te cassa nijjiṇṇāḥ honti  sammāsaṅkappa paccayā cassa aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti
translated: And the many evil unwholesome things that originate with wrong intention as condition are also reversed.

original: Te cassa bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: te ca ssa bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti
translated: And the many wholesome things that originate with right intention as condition come to fulfilment by development.

original: Evaṁ sammāvācassa sammākammantassa sammāājīvassa sammāvāyāmassa sammāsatissa sammāsamādhissa
analyzed: evam sammā vācassa sammā kammantassa sammā ājīvassa sammā vāyāmassa sammā satissa sammā samādhissa
translated: So it is with right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration,

original: sammāvimuttassa sammāvimuttiñāṇadassanassa purisapuggalassa micchāvimuttiñāṇadassanaṁ nijjiṇṇaṁ bhavati.
analyzed: sammā vimuttassa sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassanassa purisa puggalassa micchāvimutti ñāṇa dassanam nijjiṇṇam bhavati
translated: right deliverance, and right knowledge and vision of deliverance in one of right view.

original: Ye cassa micchāvimuttiñāṇadassanapaccayā uppajjeyyuṁ aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā, te cassa nijjiṇṇā honti.
analyzed: ye cassa micchāvimutti ñāṇa dassana paccayāḥ uppajjeyyum aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ te cassa nijjiṇṇāḥ honti
translated: And the many evil unwholesome states that arise because of wrong knowledge and vision are abandoned in him.

original: Sammāvimuttiñāṇadassanapaccayā cassa aneke kusalā dhammā sambhavanti, te cassa bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassana paccayā cassa aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti te cassa bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti
translated: And the many wholesome states that arise because of right knowledge and vision come to fulfilment by development.

original: Yassa vā pāṇātipātā paṭiviratassa pāṇātipāto pahīno hoti.🔽Adinnādānā paṭiviratassa adinnādānaṁ pahīnaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yassa vā pāṇātipātā paṭiviratassa pāṇātipātaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti  adinnādānā paṭiviratassa adinnādānam pahīnam hoti
translated: One who abstains from killing living beings has abandoned killing living beings.🔽One who abstains from taking what is not given has abandoned taking what is not given.

original: Brahmacārissa abrahmacariyaṁ pahīnaṁ hoti.🔽Saccavādissa musāvādo pahīno hoti.🔽Apisuṇavācassa pisuṇā vācā pahīnā hoti.
analyzed: brahmacārissa abrahmacariyam pahīnam hoti  sacca vādissa musāvādaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti  a pisuṇa vācassa pisuṇā vācā pahīnā hoti
translated: One who is celibate has abandoned unchastity.🔽One who speaks truth has abandoned false speech.🔽One who abstains from malicious speech has abandoned malicious speech.

original: Saṇhavācassa pharusā vācā pahīnā hoti.
analyzed: saṇha vācassa pharusā vācā pahīnā hoti
translated: One who abstains from harsh speech has abandoned harsh speech.

original: Kālavādissa samphappalāpo pahīno hoti.🔽Anabhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīnā hoti.
analyzed: kāla vādissa samphappalāpaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti  an abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīnā hoti
translated: He has given up idle chatter.🔽He has given up covetousness.

original: Abyāpannacittassa byāpādo pahīno hoti.
analyzed: a byāpanna cittassa byāpādaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti
translated: He has given up ill will.

original: Sammādiṭṭhissa micchādiṭṭhi pahīnā hoti.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhissa micchādiṭṭhi pahīnā hoti
translated: He has given up wrong view.

original: Ye ca kho keci ariyaṁ aṭṭhaṅgikaṁ maggaṁ garahanti, nesaṁ sandiṭṭhikā sahadhammikā gārayhā vādānuvādā āgacchanti.
analyzed: ye ca kho keci ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam garahanti na esam sandiṭṭhikā sahadhammikāḥ gārayhāḥ vāda anuvādāḥ āgacchanti
translated: And when they do, they’re open to criticism and valid objection on ten grounds.

original: Sammādiṭṭhiñca te bhavanto dhammaṁ garahanti.
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhim ca te bhavantaḥ dhammam garahanti
translated: But you criticize right view.

original: Tena hi ye micchādiṭṭhikā, tesaṁ bhavantānaṁ pujjā ca pāsaṁsā ca.
analyzed: tena hi ye micchādiṭṭhikā tesam bhavantānam pujjā ca pāsasā ca
translated: So you should praise those who have wrong view.

original: Evaṁ sammāsaṅkappaṁ sammāvācaṁ sammākammantaṁ sammāājīvaṁ sammāvāyāmaṁ sammāsatiṁ sammāsamādhiṁ sammāvimuttiṁ sammāvimuttiñāṇadassanañca te bhavanto dhammaṁ garahanti.
analyzed: evam sammā saṅkappam sammā vācam sammā kammantam sammā ājīvam sammā vāyāmam sammā satim sammā samādhim sammā vimuttim sammā vimutti ñāṇa dassanam ca te bhavantaḥ dhammam garahanti
translated: You criticize right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right freedom, and right knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Tena hi ye micchāvimuttiñāṇadassanā, tesaṁ bhavantānaṁ pujjā ca pāsaṁsā ca.
analyzed: tena hi ye micchāvimutti ñāṇa dassanā tesam bhavantānam pujjā ca pāsasā ca
translated: So you should praise those who have wrong knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Ye ca kho keci evamāhaṁsu “bhuñjitabbā kāmā, paribhuñjitabbā kāmā, āsevitabbā kāmā, nisevitabbā kāmā, bhāvayitabbā kāmā, bahulīkātabbā kāmā”ti.
analyzed: ye ca kho keci bhuñjitabbā kāmā paribhuñjitabbā kāmā āsevitabbā kāmā nisevitabbā kāmā bhāvayitabbā kāmā bahulīkātabbā kāmā ati
translated: “There are those who say that sensual pleasures should be enjoyed, that sensual pleasures should be cultivated, that sensual pleasures should be developed, that sensual pleasures should be given much practice.

original: Kāmehi veramaṇī tesaṁ adhammo.
analyzed: kāmehi veramaṇī tesam adhammaḥ
translated: “Not to abstain from sensual pleasures is contrary to the Dhamma.

original: Ye vā pana keci evamāhaṁsu “attakilamathānuyogo dhammo”ti.
analyzed: ye vā pana atta kilamatha anuyogaḥ dhammaḥ ti
translated: “There are those who say that self-mortification and self-torture are the Dhamma.

original: Niyyāniko tesaṁ dhammo adhammo.
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ tesam dhammaḥ adhammaḥ
translated: “The escape from self-mortification and self-torture is the Dhamma.

original: Ye ca kho keci evamāhaṁsu “dukkho dhammo”ti.
analyzed: ye ca kho keci evam āhasu dukkhaḥ dhammaḥ ti
translated: “There are those who say that the Dhamma is painful.

original: Sukho tesaṁ dhammo adhammo.
analyzed: sukhaḥ tesam dhammaḥ adhammaḥ
translated: “The Dhamma is pleasant.

original: Yathā vā pana bhikkhuno sabbasaṅkhāresu asubhānupassino viharato subhasaññā pahīyanti.
analyzed: yathā vā pana bhikkhuno sabba saṅkhāresu asubha anupassinaḥ viharato subha saññā pahīyanti
translated: “And how is it that, when a bhikkhu abides contemplating unattractiveness in what is attractive, the perception of what is attractive is abandoned in him?

original: Dukkhānupassino viharato sukhasaññā pahīyanti.🔽Aniccānupassino viharato niccasaññā pahīyanti.🔽Anattānupassino viharato attasaññā pahīyanti.
analyzed: dukkha anupassinaḥ viharato sukha saññā pahīyanti  anicca anupassinaḥ viharataḥ nicca saññā pahīyanti  anatta anupassinaḥ viharataḥ atta saññā pahīyanti
translated: “When he abides contemplating unattractiveness in what is attractive, the perception of what is pleasant is abandoned in him.🔽“When he abides contemplating impermanence in what is permanent, the perception of permanence is abandoned in him.🔽“When he abides contemplating non-self in what is self, the perception of self is abandoned in him.

original: Yaṁ yaṁ vā pana dhammaṁ rocayati vā upagacchati vā, tassa tassa dhammassa yo paṭipakkho, svassa aniṭṭhato ajjhāpanno bhavati.
analyzed: yam yam vā pana dhammam rocayati vā upagacchati vā tassa tassa dhammassa yaḥ paṭipakkho svassa an iṭṭhataḥ ajjhāpannaḥ bhavati
translated: “Or whatever other ideas he delights in and approves of, the perception of what is not dear to him is aroused in regard to their opposites.🔽“

original: Tenāha āyasmā mahākaccāyano “kusalākusaladhamme”ti.
analyzed: tena āha āyasmā mahākaccāyano kusala akusala dhamma iti
translated: Hence the venerable Maha Kaccana said: “Profitable and unprofitable ideas” .

original: Niyutto parivattano hāro.
analyzed: niyuttaḥ parivattanaḥ hāraḥ
translated: This is the Mode of Conveying a Conversion.
